gurmukhi: fP bwj Fol miRdMg ] Aiq qUr qwn qrMg ] nX bwsurI Aru bYn ] bhu suMdrI suB nYn ]91]
transliteration: Daph Baaj Dhol Mridan|| At(i) Toor Taan Taran|| Naya Baasuriar(u) Bain|| Bahu Soundrisoubh Nain||91||
translation: The tabor, drum, kettledrum and many other musical instruments of various tunes and tones were played; the flutes were played and there were many beautiful ladies of charming eyes seated there.91.

gurmukhi: iqh ibAwihkY Aij rwij ] bhu BwNiq lYkir dwj ] giH AweIAw suK pwie ] fP bYx bIx bjwie ]92]
transliteration: Tih Biaah(i)kai Aj(i)|| Bahu Bhaant(i) Laikar(i) Daaj|| Grih Aaiaa Souch Paae|| Daph Bain Been Bajaae||92||
translation: The king Aj wedded that damsel and taking various types of dowry and causing the tabor and lyre to be played, he retuned home with great happiness.92.

gurmukhi: Aihrwj rwj mhwn ] ds cwir cwir inDwn ] suK isMD sIl smudR ] ijin jIiqAw rx rudR ]93]
transliteration: Ahiraaj Raaj Mahaan|| Das Cdaar(i) Cdaar(i) Nidhaan|| Soukh Sindh Seel Samudra|| Jin(i) Jitiaa Ran Rudra||93||
translation: The king expert in eighteen sciences, was the ocean of pleasure and store of gentleness; he had conquered even Shiva in the war.93.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNiq rwj kmwie ] isr AqR pqR iPrwie ] rx DIr rwj ibsyK ] jg kIn jws iBKyK ]94]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant(i) Raaj Kamaae|| Sir Atra Patra Phiraae|| Ran Dheer Raaj Bisekh|| Jag Keen Jaas Bhikhaakh||94||
translation: In this waay, he ruled and caused the canopy to be swung over his head and in the whole world, the ceremonies regarding he divine kingship of that victorious king were performed.94.

gurmukhi: jg jIq cwir idswn ] Aij rwj rwj mhwn ] niRp dwn sIl phwr ] ds cwir cwr audwr ]95]
transliteration: Jag Jeet Cdaar(i) Disaan|| Aj(i) Raaj Raaj Mahaan|| Nrip Daan Seel Pahaar|| Das Cdaar(i) Chaar Udaar||95||
translation: The king Aj, after conquering all the four directions, gave charities of materials as a generous king; being expert in all sciences, that king was extremely benevolent.95.

gurmukhi: duiqvMiq suMdr nYn ] ijh pyiK iK`Jq mYn ] muiK dyiK cMdR srUp ] icq sO curwvq BUp ]96]
transliteration: Dout(i)vant(i) Soundar Nain|| Jih Pekh(i) Khijjhat Main|| Moukh(i) Dekh(i) Channdra Daroop|| Ik Hot Kathaa Pasaar||96||
translation: His eyes and body were so charming, hat even the god of love felt jealous; hundreds of kings evaded him, seeing the moonlike beauty of his face.96.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq kY bf rwj ] bhu j`g Drm smwj ] jau kho srb ibcwr ] iek hoq kQw pswr ]97]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Kai Bad Raaj|| Bahu Jagg Dharam Samaaj|| Jau Kaho Sarab Bichaar|| Ik Hot Kathaa Pasaar||97||
translation: In this way, the king ruled like a great sovereign in the world doing religious and social services and performing Yajnas; if I narrate all the things associated with him, the story will be greatly increased.97.

gurmukhi: iqh qy su QorIAY bwq ] suin lyhu BwKo BRwq ] bhu j`g Drm smwj ] ieh BwNiq kY Aijrwj ]98]
transliteration: Tih Te Su Thoreeaibaat|| Soun(i) Leh(u) Bhaakho Bhraat|| Bahu Jagg Dharam Samaaj|| Eh Bhaant(i) Kai Ajiraaj||98||
translation: Therefore, I say in brief, O brothers ! listen to it; the king Aj ruled in this way in various ways in religions and society.98.

gurmukhi: jg Awpno Aij mwn ] qr AwNK Awn n Awn ] qb kwl kop kÍwl ] Aij jwrIAw miD jÍwl ]99]
transliteration: Jag Aapano Aj(i) Maan|| Tar Aankh Aan Na Aan|| Tab Kaal Kop Kravaal|| Aj(i) Jaariaa Madh(i) Jvaal||99||
translation: He abandoned the idea of considering the whole world as his own and did not care for anyone; then the great Death, in great rage, reduced king Aj to ashes in his fire.99.

gurmukhi: Aij joiq joiq imlwn ] qb srb dyiK frwn ] ijm nwv Kyvt hIn ] ijm dyh Ar bl CIn ]100]
transliteration: Aj(i) Jot(i) Milaan|| Tab Sarab Dekh(i) Daraan|| Jim Naav Khevat Heen|| Jim Deh Ar Bal Chheen||100||
translation: Seeing the king Aj merging in the supreme Light, all the people became fearful like the passengers of a boat without the sailor; the people became weak like the individual becoming helpless with the loss of physical strength.100.

gurmukhi: ijm gwNv rwv ibhIn ] ijm aur brw kiRs CIn ] ijm idrb hIn BMfwr ] ijm Swih hIn ibpwr ]101]
transliteration: Jim Gadnv Raav Biheen|| Jim Ur Baraa Kris Chheen|| Jim Dirab Heen Bhandaar|| Jim Shaah(i) Been Bipaar||101||
translation: Just as a village becomes helpless without a headman, the earth becomes meaningless without fertility, the treasure loses charm without wealth and the trader becomes in low spirit without the trade.101.

gurmukhi: ijm ArQ hIn kib`q ] ibn pRys ky ijm im`q ] ijm rwj hIn sudyS ] ijm sYn hIn nryS ]102]
transliteration: Jim Arth Heen Kabitt|| Bin Prem Ke Jim Mitt|| Jim Raaj Heen Sudesh|| Jim Sain Heen Daresh||102||
translation: Without the king, the people became like poetry without meaning, friend without love, the country without the king and as the army becomes helpless without the general.102.

gurmukhi: ijm igAwn hIn jugyNdR ] ijm BUm hIn mhyNdR ] ijm ArQhIn ibcwr ] ijm drbhIn audwr ]103]
transliteration: Jim Giaan Heen Jougendra|| Jim Bhoom Heen Mahendra|| Jim Arth-heen Bichaar|| Jim Darb-heen Udaar||103||
translation: That state becomes like a Yogi without knowledge, a king without kingdom, the idea without the meaning and the donor without the material.103.

gurmukhi: ijm AMkus hIx gjyS ] ijm sYx hIx nryS ] ijm SsqR hIn luJwr ] ijm buiD bwJ ibcwr ]104]
transliteration: Jim Ankous Heen Gadesh|| Jim Sain Heen Daresh|| Jim Shastra Heen Lujhaar|| Jim Budh(i) Baajh Bichaar||104||
translation: The people became like an elephant without a goad, the king without the army, the warrior without weapons and the ideas without wiseom.104.
